intro: Lampranthus salicola, commonly known as the yellow fireplant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in late summer to early autumn. Lampranthus salicola is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to bloom profusely under suitable conditions.
